channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Eli Lilly Surges On Strong Earnings As Mounjaro And Zepbound Sales Soar
item.description: Eli Lilly has struggled to meet overwhelming demand for Zepbound and Mounjaro and is already working to see off competition from giants like Roche and Pfizer racing to bring their own obesity drugs to market.

item.title: Silence vs noise
item.description: When a group comes together, noise is easy. Just a few people have to make a commotion for noise to happen. But silence requires everyone to be in sync.

item.title: Updated FTC Safeguards Rule: The What, Why And How
item.description: Here are some recommendations and best practices that can help organizations better comply with the FTC Safeguards mandate.

item.title: Misunderstanding bigness
item.description: IBM spent a fortune fighting calls for them to be broken up. So did AT&T and Microsoft. In all three cases, there’s plenty of evidence that they would have been better off if they had simply broken themselves up. Microsoft is still recovering and IBM never will. One computer company, one phone company, one software […]

item.title: A Tale Of Two Trade Shows: IMTS And The Detroit Auto Show
item.description: IMTS and the Detroit Auto Show are trying to navigate challenges facing trade shows in the 21st century. IMTS is going the traditional route. Detroit is making changes.

item.title: The challenge of “a risky scheme”
item.description: New ideas aren’t adopted all at once. A few people go first while the rest of us watch to see how it goes. “Look, Mikey, he likes it!” This is the story of tech innovations, dance crazes and even food. Ideas spread horizontally, and people who prefer the status quo will embrace an idea only […]

item.title: Invest Wisely To Reduce Your Company’s Exposure To Breaches
item.description: With breaches and exposures in every industry continuing to rise, there is an understandable focus on reducing and eliminating breaches.

item.title: Learning in August
item.description: What better time? An hour a day for a month and you can learn a skill you’ll have forever. Beach reads are a fine way to chill out, but a month spent to learn a skill is a fine way to take advantage of a quiet time. My brand new course on Strategy is now […]

item.title: Here’s How AI Can Turn Every Decision Into A Data-Driven One
item.description: AI shouldn’t function as the decision-maker but as an indispensable assistant in the decision-making process. Here are the steps to take to make this happen.

item.title: Reclaiming “fiasco”
item.description: Usually modified with “total,” the failure might not be as bad as we fear. The origin of the word probably comes from Italian, a long time ago. The person who loses a round in a game has to buy the next bottle for the group (from: flask). Which means that there is going to be […]
